New Records: Ross Adair wins the Player of the Series award
Ross Adair wins the Player of the Match award
Key Match Events: Ireland's bowlers turned the tide and struck at regular intervals to stall the Proteas' progress
Ireland's spirited fightback ensured they defended the total, leveling the series and denying South Africa a clean sweep
Ross Adair recorded his ton, but in the end, it is the win that matters the most
Lungi Ngidi is the last batter for South Africa. He will face the hat-trick ball
Ireland beat South Africa by 10 runs
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland will hope that their bowling attack can really up their game
Aiden Markram will hope that the Proteas can once again step up their performances as they aim to secure their second win and confirm a clean-sweep series victory
Post-Match Reflections: Paul Stirling, the winning captain is in for a chat. He says that at the halfway mark, the team felt they were 15-20 runs short
Aiden Markram, the captain of South Africa starts by saying that there were small moments with both bat and ball, which they missed on
Ross Adair says that he wanted to put his mark and get a good score
Paul Stirling will be elated with the way his bowler’s came back in the game
Miscellaneous Highlights: As for the weather conditions in the capital city, hardly any chance of interruptions due to rain and expect the temperature to hover at the 30 degrees Celsius mark proving to be a warm and fiery contest between the two sides
The Irish side will be under pressure to step up after their loss in the previous game
South Africa has looked a much better side after the poor show in the UAE against Afghanistan earlier
Others: The first ball will be at 11.30 am GMT, but you’ll know that you can join us early for the build-up
So, Stay tuned for more exciting cricket action, and until next time, take care and keep cheering!
Ross Adair is also the Player of the Series
